• Layout
  • Content

Layout

Here is some description...

Containers

Containers are the most basic layout element and are required when using our default grid system.

                    
                        <div class="container"></div>

Use .container-fluid for a full width container, spanning the entire width of the viewport.

                    
                        <div class="container-fluid"></div>

Grid System

The grid system is a port from Flexbox Grid.

                    <div class="row">
     <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-2"></div>
     <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-10"></div>
     <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-3"></div>
     <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-9"></div>
     <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-4"></div>
     <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-8"></div>
     <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-5"></div>
     <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-7"></div>
     <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-6"></div>
     <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-6"></div>
     <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-7"></div>
     <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-5"></div>
     <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-8"></div>
     <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-4"></div>
     <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-9"></div>
     <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-3"></div>
     <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-10"></div>
     <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-2"></div>
 </div>

For more examples and documentation, please visit Flexbox Grid's site.
